titleStmt.title: Jeff Brown to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4278

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville 7 Oct. 1863.
Hon Thos E. Bramlett
Govenor of Ky.
Dear Sir;

I received yours of 10th Septr last. I immediately wrote for, and have since obtained copies of the Indictments as well as the judgments upon which executives issued alluded to in yours. It seems one indictment was for attempting to entice away the negro girl Sarilla, and the other was for stealing her apparl jewelry &c, all belonging to the said girl, tho the indictment it was the property of John Dawson, which is not true as it was the property of the negro girl. You will find a letter to this effect of C. J. VanderEspt, who was living there at the time, and whose testimony would have exonerated Garis.
I am in hopes you will send a full remission of the Judgments. The parties are poor and very needy, and if compelled to pay even half of it would bring a perfect ruin upon them.
